Class Room

java.lang.Object
Room
public class Room extends Object
The Room class contains information about a Room in a Hotel. A Room contains information about its price per night, its room number, and its availability. A Room can set its own pricing, availability and number with the correct convention, alongside giving its complete information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Room(int number)
    Constructs a Room object that asks for the number that will be assigned to the object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room(int number)
      Constructs a Room object that asks for the number that will be assigned to the object.
      Parameters:
      number - number given must be within the range of 100-510 while only being up to 9 in the ones digit. (ex. 100-109 must be followed and the next number would jump immediately to 200)

  • Method Details

    • getRoomNumber

      public int getRoomNumber()
      Gives the number of a Room.
      Returns:
      number of a Room

    • setRoomNumber

      public boolean setRoomNumber(int number)
      Sets the number of a Room.
      Parameters:
      number - number must follow the naming convention
      Returns:
      true if convention was followed, false if otherwise
